name: 2-{[(pyridin-2-ylamino)methyl]amino}naphthalene-1,4-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1906
Reason: 1,4-dione base, with a melting point around 100 degrees Celsius, due to the presence of two carbonyl groups, which can participate in dipole interactions and rigidify the structure. Each carbonyl group may contribute around +20 to +30°C. The pyridine ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C. The methylamino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The amino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5°C. The naphthalene ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +20°C.
